sect1.title: Description of the Population
sect1.para: A diagnostic diagnostic interview is a useful first step in the assessment and treatment of a child with potential mental health concerns. There are several factors particular to youth and families that may impact the process of diagnostic interviewing. Like diagnostic interviewing with other populations, it is of utmost importance to approach the process with children with genuine warmth, sensitivity, and cultural humility to build and maintain rapport throughout the interview process. This chapter presents information relevant to the diagnostic interviewing process with children (and their caregivers), including developmental considerations, guidelines for gathering information, a case study to illustrate the process, and strategies for engaging diverse youth populations.
